conclusion: Consider changes in position and size of shadows if light source moves forward.
If light source moves forward, shadow of Object A will increase in size and move closer to the object.
Object B is a blue object with a circular shape.
If light source moves forward, shadow of Object B will increase in size and move closer to the object.
Object C is a round object with a pinkish-red surface.
If light source moves forward, shadow of Object C will increase in size and move closer to the object.
Object D is a rectangular object with a waffle-like texture.
If light source moves forward, shadow of Object D will increase in size and move closer to the object.
Summary: All four objects will cast larger shadows and move closer to the objects as the light source moves forward.
